Posts.Content: May 2, 2009 09:49AM Cheyanne wrote: My surgery is over with, just browing here...but saw the note about MRI.  I had 2 MRIs and they were the worst things I had of all.  (I had a spinal MRI 10+ years ago when I was being diagnosed for back pain and that was nothing.)  I met the head of Radiology on my way out, after the first one; I know him pretty well, used to work for him.  He asked me how I was doing and I said fine until you guys put me into that torture machine you brought in here from Gitmo.  Oh well, could have been worse.
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 05:49PM Cheyanne wrote: I have had surgery more times during the past 40+ years I've forgotten most of it.  Seems like everything I have has either been sucked out, replaced or whacked off.  Anyway, I have had surgery now 4 times in the past couple of years.  What they do here is give you a little Versed in your IV and then you don't care what they do to you.  I have never seen the operating room of our local hospital because each time I have been asleep before I got there. By the way, have had:  appendectomy, tubal ligation, hysterectomy, total hip replacement, ankle pinning, renal stone removal and stenting, gallbladder surgery, and now lumpectomy and mastectomy.  Yup, its either been sucked out, replaced or whacked off.
